body:
Hi @maosongfu ,

I am looking at the changes in `783aff9`. It seems there is some misunderstanding. The scheduler works on YARN and I have tested it many times. Can we please discuss before you commit any changes?

Also I am not sure if I understand why associating a name with `TODO` comment is needed. Once open sourced anyone should be able to work on a enhancement. It may not feasible to reach a "owner" for understanding the issue or waiting for the person to fix the issue. 

Thanks,
Ashvin

Hi @ashvina 

-- Can we please discuss before you commit any changes?
As mentoined in the description, this Pull Request is considered only as a Code Review and will never be checked in; I used the PR to put my comments since it is easier for me to do that. That's also why this PR is "closed" and not pushed to your branch. Sorry if any confusion.

-- The scheduler works on YARN and I have tested it many times.
We can discuss together. As I mentioned in the reviews (TODO comments), a lot of cases, especially failure cases, could be overlooked.

-- why associating a name with TODO comment is needed
This is a convention used in Twitter. Associating a name with TODO indicates the person who left the TODO; others can fix and remove it. We can discuss and come up a uniform way to write TODO.

Sorry if any confusion. Please treat this PR as a Review, and resolve my changes or TODO(mfu) in your branch. We may discuss in this PR.
Great ! Thanks for the clarifications. I am reviewing the pull request.

@kramasamy @billonahill local Darwin and AWS Ubuntu failing on "bazel build" command, has command changed or is this a known issue? thanks!

```
$bazel build --config=darwin heron/...

ERROR: /Users/lewiskan/OpenSource/heron/WORKSPACE:12:1: maven_jar rule //external:commons-beanutils's name field must be a legal workspace name.
ERROR: /Users/lewiskan/OpenSource/heron/WORKSPACE:17:1: maven_jar rule //external:commons-cli's name field must be a legal workspace name.
ERROR: /Users/lewiskan/OpenSource/heron/WORKSPACE:22:1: maven_jar rule //external:commons-collections's name field must be a legal workspace name.
ERROR: /Users/lewiskan/OpenSource/heron/WORKSPACE:27:1: maven_jar rule //external:commons-lang's name field must be a legal workspace name.
ERROR: /Users/lewiskan/OpenSource/heron/WORKSPACE:32:1: maven_jar rule //external:commons-logging's name field must be a legal workspace name.
ERROR: /Users/lewiskan/OpenSource/heron/WORKSPACE:42:1: maven_jar rule //external:protobuf-java's name field must be a legal workspace name.
ERROR: Error evaluating WORKSPACE file.
ERROR: package contains errors: heron/statemgrs/conf.
ERROR: no such package 'external': Package 'external' contains errors.
INFO: Elapsed time: 0.171s
```

(aws Ubuntu)

```
$ bazel build --config=ubuntu scripts/packages:binpkgs  --verbose_failures  --genrule_strategy=standalone --ignore_unsupported_sandboxing --sandbox_debug --spawn_strategy=standalone

ERROR: /home/ubuntu/heron/WORKSPACE:12:1: maven_jar rule //external:commons-beanutils's name field must be a legal workspace name.
ERROR: /home/ubuntu/heron/WORKSPACE:17:1: maven_jar rule //external:commons-cli's name field must be a legal workspace name.
ERROR: /home/ubuntu/heron/WORKSPACE:22:1: maven_jar rule //external:commons-collections's name field must be a legal workspace name.
ERROR: /home/ubuntu/heron/WORKSPACE:27:1: maven_jar rule //external:commons-lang's name field must be a legal workspace name.
ERROR: /home/ubuntu/heron/WORKSPACE:32:1: maven_jar rule //external:commons-logging's name field must be a legal workspace name.
ERROR: /home/ubuntu/heron/WORKSPACE:42:1: maven_jar rule //external:protobuf-java's name field must be a legal workspace name.
ERROR: Error evaluating WORKSPACE file.
ERROR: no such package '@bazel_tools//tools/cpp': error loading package 'external': Could not load //external package.
INFO: Elapsed time: 0.279s
```

This seems to be sandboxing issue - the following command seems to work as reported by @supunkamburugamuve 

```
bazel build --config=ubuntu scripts/packages:binpkgs  --verbose_failures  --genrule_strategy=standalone --ignore_unsupported_sandboxing --sandbox_debug --spawn_strategy=standalone
```

I tried several variations of the following - 

```
# Check whether there are any uncommited changes
if [ -z ${HERON_TREE_STATUS+x} ];
then
  cmd="git diff-index --quiet HEAD -- || true"
  status=$($cmd)
  if [[ ${status} == 0 ]];
  then
    tree_status="Clean"
  elif
    tree_status="Modified"
  else
    tree_status="Unknown"
  fi
else
  tree_status=${HERON_TREE_STATUS}
fi
```

and it did not work!
@kramasamy I think you want to `|| true` part in in the script, not in the cmd that you shell out to.

This is a Bazel > 0.1.2 issue as I was using Bazel 0.2.2 and 0.2.0.  
Note: Bazel 0.1.5 now rejects maven jars with dots or dashes in their names
https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/874

@lewiskan are you building on an ubuntu host? If not, you need to build with docker:

```
cd docker
./build-artifacts.sh ubuntu15.10 0.12.0 .
./build-artifacts.sh ubuntu14.04 0.12.0 .
./build-artifacts.sh centos7 0.12.0 .
```

For example this works:

``` bash
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -e

cmd="cat /does/not/exist"
$($cmd || true)
echo "status: $?"
```

Outputs:

```
:!bash /private/tmp/foo.sh

cat: /does/not/exist: No such file or directory
status: 0
```

I think you need to change `status=$($cmd)` to `status=$($cmd || true)` and remove it from where you set `cmd=`

@billonahill yes, ubuntu host to test bazel sandbox errors from #108 and the recent heron-user thread:
karthik cited: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/bazel-discuss/kHvq5faKiTw
and supan found the following command to work (turning off sandbox):

```
bazel build --config=ubuntu scripts/packages:binpkgs  --verbose_failures  --genrule_strategy=standalone --ignore_unsupported_sandboxing --sandbox_debug --spawn_strategy=standalone
```

we need to update Ubuntu host directions to avoid the sandbox issue and i'm testing this now on aws.

@kramasamy @billonahill Supan's Ubuntu commands compile successfully on aws (confirming sandbox issue, finally!).  
However, in addition to simple apt-get installs, we needed to manually install:
1) libtool-2.4.6 , since "sudo apt-get install libtool" installs a lower than required v2.4.2, (unchecked by bazel_configure.py)
after multiple gperftools errors, and following http://gperftools.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/INSTALL 
2) libunwind-1.1
3) gperftools-2.5

after these 3 installations via .tar, the following commands work:

```
bazel build --config=ubuntu heron/...  --verbose_failures \  
--genrule_strategy=standalone --ignore_unsupported_sandboxing \
--sandbox_debug --spawn_strategy=standalone
```

```
bazel build --config=ubuntu scripts/packages:binpkgs  --verbose_failures \  
--genrule_strategy=standalone --ignore_unsupported_sandboxing \
--sandbox_debug --spawn_strategy=standalone
```

I can add the above commands to Ubuntu compile web directions but want to confirm that we should include the libtool, libunwind and gperftools instructions.  Attached is a .txt file outlining all required steps, thanks.
[aws-ubuntu-heron.txt](https://github.com/twitter/heron/files/235720/aws-ubuntu-heron.txt)
I also had to install the above tools in order to get the build working.
thank you all for the suggestion. Going with @ajorgensen suggestion!

@ajorgensen - As you suggested, I have added 

```
set -eu
```
👍  - after the travis ci fix goes in. please merge with the master and rerun the travis ci to ensure everything is fine - before checkin.

thanks @lewiskan and @supunkamburugamuve - let me get the ubuntu build streamlined with the appropriate options. a few clarifications - 
- for installing libtool-2.4.6 - what command did you use?
- i will see if libunwind can brought into the code base itself so that it is self reliant
- what are the errors in gperftools that occurred so that i can understand

thanks @kramasamy and @supunkamburugamuve , attached is .txt of all commands for aws Ubuntu 14.04, namely:
- installing libtool-2.4.6 (NOTE: 'sudo apt-get install libtool' installs 2.4.2)

```
cd /home/ubuntu
#https://www.gnu.org/software/libtool/
wget http://ftpmirror.gnu.org/libtool/libtool-2.4.6.tar.gz
tar -xvf libtool-2.4.6.tar.gz && cd libtool-2.4.6
./configure
sudo make
sudo make install
```
- error message if libunwind and gperftools is not installed

```
config.status: executing libtool commands
configure: error: in `/tmp/gperftools.Q9gsI/gperftools-2.4':
configure: error: No frame pointers and no libunwind. The compilation will fail
[aws-ubuntu-heron.txt](https://github.com/twitter/heron/files/236682/aws-ubuntu-heron.txt)

See `config.log' for more details
ERROR: /home/ubuntu/heron/3rdparty/gperftools/BUILD:11:1: Executing genrule //3rdparty/gperftools:gperftools-srcs failed: bash failed: error executing command
  (cd /home/ubuntu/.cache/bazel/_bazel_ubuntu/49c4744f9ca584202f9a40692e0a51e0/heron && \
  exec env - \
    PATH=/home/ubuntu/bin:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin:/usr/games:/usr/local/games \
  /bin/bash -c 'source external/bazel_tools/tools/genrule/genrule-setup.sh; export INSTALL_DIR=$(pwd)/bazel-out/local_linux-fastbuild/genfiles/3rdparty/gperftools
export TMP_DIR=$(mktemp -d -t gperftools.XXXXX)
mkdir -p $TMP_DIR
cp -R 3rdparty/gperftools/gperftools-2.4.tar.gz $TMP_DIR
cd $TMP_DIR
tar xfz gperftools-2.4.tar.gz
cd gperftools-2.4
./configure --prefix=$INSTALL_DIR --enable-shared=no
make install
rm -rf $TMP_DIR'): com.google.devtools.build.lib.shell.BadExitStatusException: Process exited with status 1: bash failed: error executing command
  (cd /home/ubuntu/.cache/bazel/_bazel_ubuntu/49c4744f9ca584202f9a40692e0a51e0/heron && \
  exec env - \
    PATH=/home/ubuntu/bin:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin:/usr/games:/usr/local/games \
  /bin/bash -c 'source external/bazel_tools/tools/genrule/genrule-setup.sh; export INSTALL_DIR=$(pwd)/bazel-out/local_linux-fastbuild/genfiles/3rdparty/gperftools
export TMP_DIR=$(mktemp -d -t gperftools.XXXXX)
mkdir -p $TMP_DIR
cp -R 3rdparty/gperftools/gperftools-2.4.tar.gz $TMP_DIR
cd $TMP_DIR
tar xfz gperftools-2.4.tar.gz
cd gperftools-2.4
./configure --prefix=$INSTALL_DIR --enable-shared=no
make install
rm -rf $TMP_DIR'): com.google.devtools.build.lib.shell.BadExitStatusException: Process exited with status 1.
INFO: Elapsed time: 25.187s, Critical Path: 14.94s.
```

[aws-ubuntu-heron.txt](https://github.com/twitter/heron/files/236685/aws-ubuntu-heron.txt)
@billonahill - can you merge this branch with the latest master and kick ci build to ensure that travis-ci passes?
@billonahill - can you merge with the latest master and update the PR to ensure that travis-ci passes?
@lucperkins is this issue resolved or still pending?

@kramasamy The patch was reviewed by @maosongfu and @osgigeek. I have resolved some. I am working on Driver HA and improving request synchronization. Some others have been marked as TODO notes. In my opinion these issues can be incrementally resolved.

I think the check failing on Travis could be related to maven integration. I am looking at this now.
You'll also want to update the index and fix the broken links to developer docs that are referenced in Issue #346.
Left a few comments, but looks good otherwise
I suggest not using the atypical `this.foo = aFoo` and instead using the more idiomatic `this.foo = foo`.
+1 - it will be good to fix.
This is considered as not an issue - since local scheduler is for development at this stage.
One of the challenges is that only one stream is considered. The scenario when a component consumes or emits more than one stream is not even handled, and need to thought through.

Current count of `heron/` alone is 949:

```
$ bazel build heron/... &> build_warnings.txt
$ grep "warnings$" build_warnings.txt | awk '{ sum+=$1} END {print sum}'
949
```

And here's the breakdown of warning types:

```
$ egrep "\.java:[0-9]+: warning: " build_warnings.txt | egrep -o "(\[.*])" | sort | uniq -c
   3 [cast]
 251 [deprecation]
 354 [rawtypes]
  91 [serial]
  37 [static]
   6 [try]
 215 [unchecked]
```
PR #485 fixes `heron/common` and a few other easy ones.
PR #489 adds serializableVersionID to all serializable classes.

It's been quite a while since I've written cpp, but lgtm.

:+1:

PR #490 disabled warnings from thrift and proto code-gened files.

Now we're down to these, which are mostly from passing un-typed Map config objects around. Working on that next:

```
$ bazel clean && bazel build heron/... &> build_warnings.txt
$ egrep "\.java:[0-9]+: warning: " build_warnings.txt | egrep -o "(\[.*])" | sort | uniq -c
 334 [rawtypes]
 214 [unchecked]
```
